page.title: 04FARMING
page.content: In the BURTON HASTINGS area there are 7 farms.The average size is 122acres. The average age is 168 years old, although some have modern extensions. Most of the farms are owner-occupied. Crops grown include wheat, barley,sugar beet, potatoes,rape and bulbs.Cereals are the predominent crop of the area.There is some dairy farming with Fresian cows and some rearing of Hereford bullocks.Other farm animals include pigs,sheep chickens, ducks, geese and working dogs.The machinery on the farms consists of tractors, ploughs, combine harvesters, harrows, balers, seed drills, vacuum mudsuckers and conveyor belts.Some crops such as potatoes are sold directly to the public. On one farm the wheatt is put through a machine and is used to feed chickens.
